column4: I'm getting an error: Sense Key : Medium Error [current] [descriptor] in my dmesg (the hard disk in question is NTFS, am trying to back it up, but it keeps freezing) any idea what that error means?
that actually sounds like a hardware problem, not a partition one. Can you pastebin a bit of context?
that's the hardware or driver failing, not (just) the partition data being unhappy. If that drive supports smart (most do) running smartctl on it may be interesting.
I did that last time, and it didn't give any errors
(also check for obvious problems like loose cables)
if smart says it's ok I'd suspect either the connection or the drivers
it's running a little hot, and if I skim the output correctly at least one sector is physically bad. Recommend you get any still readable data off the drive asap (utilities like dd_rescue may help)
you can use that to copy the raw partition around (to a different drive), after which you can hopefully run a standard partition repair utility on the result and recover most data
you'll need free space on the target drive for the size of the partition(s) you're recovering, yes. So ideally a slightly larger drive so you can copy everything in one go.
how can I fsck on boot?
I don't have enough space on one drive :(
sorry, that's an ubuntu-specific question I can't answer. Ask the channel. I'm not even currently in ubuntu :)
